content.title: Maintenance Of Pregnant Desi/Indigenous Cow/Buffalo Ration Scheme For BPL Families Belonging To Scheduled Caste Category
content.department: Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Families belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) of Scheduled Caste category
content.details: The scheme provides cattle feed to the pregnant cows and buffaloes of BPL families belonging to the Scheduled Caste category on a 50% subsidy for the last trimester (three months) of pregnancy.
benefits: Balanced ration @ 3kg/day/cow or buffalo for a maximum of two animals for three months during the last trimester of pregnancy at 50% subsidy.
Increase in milk production by 2 liters/day after feeding a balanced ration during the last trimester of pregnancy.
Estimated income increase of Rs.18000/year (Approx.) from milk production.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Himachal Pradesh.
Livestock owners belonging to BPL of Scheduled Caste category families rearing Desi/Indigenous/crossbred cows or buffaloes are eligible under the scheme.
The subsidy will be provided for a maximum of up to two Desi/Indigenous cows/their crosses or buffaloes.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Increase milk production, reduce inter-calving period, improve health of pregnant cows & buffaloes, ensure healthy calves, and motivate farmers to rear Desi/Indigenous animals.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Livestock owners belonging to BPL of Scheduled Caste category families rearing Desi/ Indigenous/ crossbred cows or buffaloes.

faqs.question: At what rate will the balanced ration be provided to the eligible beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Families will be provided a balanced ration @ 3kg/day/cow or buffalo.

faqs.question: For how many animals will the balanced ration be provided?
faqs.answer: The balanced ration will be provided for a maximum of up to two Desi/Indigenous cows/their crosses or buffaloes.

faqs.question: For how many months will the balanced ration be provided for the animals?
faqs.answer: The balanced ration will be provided for three months during the last trimester of pregnancy.

faqs.question: How much will subsidy be provided to each eligible beneficiary under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The balanced ration will be provided at a 50% subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the ratio of cost shared by the Government and beneficiary under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The cost will be shared by the Govt. and beneficiary on a 50:50 basis.

faqs.question: What is the outcome of this scheme?
faqs.answer: After feeding a balanced ration during the last trimester of pregnancy, milk production increased by 2 liters/day.

faqs.question: How can I apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary may apply online mode.
